citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
During inspection of the dairy unit, the following expired medications were found on the main pharmaceutical shelf in the
treatment area:
Ampicillin injectable 25 gm bottle - expiration date 09/2023 (2 bottles), Oxytetracycline injectable 250 mg/ml 250 ml bottle
- expiration date 10/2023 (1 bottle), Vitamin K1 injectable 10mg/ml 100 ml bottle - expiration date 01/2024 (1 bottle),
Epinephrine injectable 1mg/ml 50 ml bottle - expiration date 06-2023 (1 bottle), Spectramast ceftiofur intramammary
infusion 125 mg 10 ml syringes - expiration date 11/2023.
The use of expired medications does not meet acceptable standards of veterinary practice and their usage may not be
safe nor efficacious. It is the responsibility of the research facility to ensure that the use of appropriate methods to
prevent, control, and treat diseases and injuries are utilized in order to maintain the health and well-being of the animals
as set forth in this section.
Correction: immediately
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the SDSU Attending Veterinarian.
n

narrative:
2.33(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
During inspection of the dairy unit, the following expired medications were found on the main pharmaceutical shelf in the 
treatment area:  
Ampicillin injectable 25 gm bottle - expiration date 09/2023 (2 bottles), Oxytetracycline injectable 250 mg/ml 250 ml bottle 
- expiration date 10/2023 (1 bottle), Vitamin K1 injectable 10mg/ml 100 ml bottle - expiration date 01/2024 (1 bottle), 
Epinephrine injectable 1mg/ml 50 ml bottle - expiration date 06-2023 (1 bottle), Spectramast ceftiofur intramammary 
infusion 125 mg 10 ml syringes - expiration date 11/2023. 
 The use of expired medications does not meet acceptable standards of veterinary practice and their usage may not be 
safe nor efficacious. It is the responsibility of the research facility to ensure that the use of appropriate methods to 
prevent, control, and treat diseases and injuries are utilized in order to maintain the health and well-being of the animals 
as set forth in this section. 
 
Correction: immediately 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the SDSU Attending Veterinarian.
